Summary
We introduce a method and a prototype system for interactive exploration of volumetric data using a tangible screen, called the
Volume Slicing Display. The system tracks the shape and the position of a passive screen (a piece of plexiglas or paper) using a
custom monocular high-speed vision system (Vision Chip) or using ARToolkit markers in a more recent setup conceived to be built
from off-the-shelf hardware; then one or more projectors on the room project the corresponding slice of a 3D virtual object on that
surface in real time. This experimental interface will enable multiple users to feel as if 3D virtual objects co-exist in real space, as
well as to explore them interactively using cheap passive projection surfaces (plexiglas or even paper).
